headlines.title: Sleep paralysis: Science, causes and treatments
headlines.description: Around 30% of people will experience sleep paralysis at least once. Here’s why and what you can do about it.

headlines.title: 10 Times AI And Robotics Have Done Horrible Things
headlines.description: "Your scientists were so preoccupied with whether or not they could, they didn't stop to think if they should."

headlines.title: Experts are certain, the next major volcanic eruption will cause climate chaos.
headlines.description: The scientific community has raised an urgent alarm regarding our global unpreparedness for the next major volcanic eruption. In a compelling study published in Nature, climatologists and geographers warn that such an event could trigger unprecedented climate chaos in our warming world. This warning demands immediate attention from governments worldwide.…

headlines.title: Afghans who helped US war effort feel betrayed by Trump’s travel ban
headlines.description: When President Donald Trump’s issued a proclamation on Wednesday evening that citizens from Afghanistan, along with 11 other nations, would be blocked from coming to the United States, it added even more fear, uncertainty and for some, a sense of betrayal, for vulnerable Afghans.

headlines.title: OnePlus Pad 3 review: perfect for play, not for work
headlines.description: The OnePlus Pad 3 adds modest hardware and meaningful software upgrades at a higher price. It’s better than ever for entertainment, but still not ideal for work.

headlines.title: Travis Decker: How a manhunt for a father accused of killing his 3 daughters is unfolding
headlines.description: Olivia, Evelyn and Paityn Decker were found suffocated to death at an abandoned campsite in Washington state. A massive search is now underway for their father, an Army veteran and National Guardsman.

headlines.title: The most fun camera app I’ve used in forever
headlines.description: Not Boring Camera for iOS, the Nintendo Switch 2, Mario Kart World, Good Night and Good Luck, and more in this week’s Installer newsletter.

headlines.title: Italians vote on citizenship rules, labor laws
headlines.description: Italians are voting on referendums that would make it easier for children born to foreigners to gain citizenship. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has urged supporters to skip the vote.

headlines.title: Russia claims to have pushed into central Ukrainian region for first time
headlines.description: Russia claimed Sunday that its forces are for the first time pushing into the central Ukrainian region of Dnipropetrovsk, an area it has been trying to reach for months, in a move that could create new problems for Kyiv’s much-stretched forces.

headlines.title: Gauff persuaded herself she could win French Open and did
headlines.description: A little bit of self-persuasion went a very long way for Coco Gauff, whose victory at the French Open gave the 21-year-old American a trophy she has long coveted, and a second major title.
